>So said Dave Astels on 2003-05-06 --------------------
>--- In junit@yahoo=
groups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>
>> No, because Test=
-Driven Development guarantees sufficiently high 
>> coverage, so I haven't=
 found measuring test coverage to be useful. 
>> That's just personal taste=
.
>
>Agreed.  But, measuring coverage (and quality with a tool like JesTer)=

>is useful with a group that is still learning to TDD properly.  It's
>not=
 so much looking for full coverage as an indication that all is
>right, it'=
s more looking for holes in the coverage that indicate that
>tests are miss=
ing.  And, yes, 100% is unrealistic because there will
>always be things th=
at don't need testing.. like toString methods that
>are to make test result=
s more meaningful.

Perhaps I just don't know how bad I am at TDD yet. Mayb=
e I'm awful. Maybe I'm afraid that JesTer will show me that. :) Damn subcon=
scious!

Now I need a project to try out JesTer on my code. This winter, pe=
rhaps.
